title: Is Webnovel owned by the Qidian? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yeah, they are. Before paying for access to novels in Webnovel - Your Fictional Stories Hub I recommend to check this post Qidian Authors hit by Chinese censorship Not only Qidian never fight against Chinese censorship, they even helping gov to close whatever novels they want. Ton’s of great novels get deleted from the internet because of them. The most funny thing - no one knows why their novels got closed. Authors re-write blocked chapters (they’re actually lucky if only chapters get banned and not the whole novel) several times just to know what did they write wrong. Even a lot of pro-china novels get deleted. Why? some high up from gov didn’t like them. Maybe author dared to write something bad about the USA/Japan or SEA. Yes, even this can lead to novel get deleted. ofc writing bad about USSR/Russia sometimes can save novel. Chinese high up loving this. I know it sounds ridiculous, but it’s true. As for why Chinese authors just not use a free novel website, because qidian (and other p2r websites) pay them. You can write a good story on free websites and earn 0, while writing on qidian even if no one reads your novel can bring an author at least some money.

Webnovel - Your Fictional Stories Hub is Qidian’s international site. qidian.comhas original and translated Chinese content, while Webnovel has english translations of Chinese, Korean, Japanese (eastern in general) stories, while also hosting Inkstone-QiDian International's novel translation platform, for translators and writers.For us westerners, Webnovel is basically equal to Qidian, as you’d have to speak (well, read, in this case) Chinese to visit their main site, but their international site is in English, much more accessible to the western world, and we wouldn’t even see the main site due to this, only the international one.
